summary: Mission feature enhancements: archive 100% completed missions, default view shows incomplete missions with swipe navigation to completed missions, allow swipe-delete on completed missions, and move missions back to incomplete when a task is marked incomplete in a completed mission (no other app changes).
architectural_notes: Scope constraint: do not change anything outside the Mission feature; focus only on Mission behavior/UI.

existing_features.title: In the Missions full-screen view, automatically classify missions as "Completed" (archived) when they are 100% complete (all tasks completed and task count > 0), and as "Incomplete" otherwise. Default the Missions view to show only the Incomplete list when the user opens Missions.

Add horizontal swipe navigation in the Missions full-screen view: swiping right switches from the Incomplete list to the Completed (archived) list; swiping left switches from the Completed list back to the Incomplete list. Also provide a visible, tappable option to switch between Incomplete and Completed lists (English labels).

Ensure missions in the Completed (archived) list can be deleted via swipe actions (same behavior as the current swipe-delete in Missions list), and that deleting a completed mission updates the UI immediately and correctly.

When a mission is in the Completed (archived) state and the user marks any task as incomplete within the mission detail view, the mission must automatically move back to the Incomplete missions list (i.e., it should no longer appear in Completed once progress drops below 100%).

new_feature_requests.summary: Archive missions that are 100% completed; default missions view shows only incomplete missions
Add swipe navigation in Missions: swipe right shows completed missions, swipe left shows incomplete missions
Allow deleting completed (archived) missions via swipe action
If a task is marked incomplete inside a completed mission, move that mission back to the incomplete missions list

projectName: Archive 100%-completed missions and add swipe navigation between incomplete and completed lists
